Reviews.Content: Geat Hotel I and my wife are from the US and just stayed at the Ambassador, Frankfurt. We were on the 3rd floor and found the hotel to be quite nice. The hotel staff was friendly, spoke English and was very helpful. Rooms were clean, modern probably newly renovated and well taken care of. We were concern about reviews of the red light district, but was never harassed or felt threaten. In fact, the accommodations/ assistance were better and general threat level less than any of our trips New Orleans Bourbon Street. There was some street noise but, not bad. Its close proximity to the train station worked out well for our travels. I would recommend staying there and will again when returning to Frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: Pete581

Reviews.Content: Would return..... Location is excellent.... Everything within walking distance.... Top floor of the hotel has just been renovated, and I'd recommend you to request a room up there.... However, bathrooms are see-through (v.European according to porter)..... But much more up-to-date than older rooms..... Rooms were old-fashioned, but clean which is the main thing.... Staff weren't unpleasant, they were ignorant..... Madrid is a great city, would definately return.... Great to shop.... Great to dine.... Great to drink...... I'll be going back.........
Reviews.Author: Shnucks

Reviews.Content: Very Clean I am from the U.S. and I stayed here 5 nights, it is very close to the train station. From the train station to the hotel it is an ok area. I read on here it was sketchy, but did not get that feeling. If you go past the hotel you go into the financial district. I never saw other than one location for the red light district, never saw a hooker, or other rif raf. There is a great Irish bar one block away, Mc Donalds and other eateries at the train station, and even a starbucks. The hotel was very clean, and the front desk staff was very curtious. The bed was typical European, and the pillows are firm. It is an older hotel, but has style to it. The internet was down for wireless, but there is a terminal in the lobby you can use, and the staff said if I had problems I could use there terminal in the office. I would equate this hotel to an old holiday inn with new furnishings. There is an alevator, vending machine. There are papers there in the morning, however, there are no irons in the room, so bring your own if you need it. It takes about 5 min. max to get there from the train station, I left every morning about 7am while it was dark and cam in at 12 to 1 and had no problems. If you are expecting luxury this is not the place, but if you would like good clean curteous service this place will work.
Reviews.Author: jbaflyer

Reviews.Content: It's "OK" for a Night The property has really nothing wrong with it. The lobby is fine, the rooms are fine and the breakfast is ok. For cheap accomodations near the train station, the property is a good choice.With that said, the neighbourhood has a bit to be desired (drug addicts, loud noise, close to the red light district).The tub of our stand-up shower did not drain. That lead to really quick showers to avoid a flood.
Reviews.Author: Cyberworld Toronto

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel In Frankfurt Located on MOSELSTRASSE 12, this hotel is within a walking distance from the main train station, 3 short stops from the international Airport (FRA), and at the heart of a bustling neighborhood of native and ethnic resturants, bars, and shops. You can easily walk to all major Frankfurt sites, the river, the main shopping district, or the financial district - or take the train or tram. The hotel itself is absolutely well designed, extremely comfortable, and the staff are incredibly nice and service-oriented. I will definitely stay there when in Frankfurt from now on. I saw some reviewers expressed concern about the neighborhood. While it is true that the hotel is near the red light district, you DO NOT have to walk through those 3 or 4 streets. In fact, you won't even know its there if you arrive by train and walk to the hotel.
Reviews.Author: rmd2k2

Reviews.Content: Great Location Booked the room directly through their Internet site, which got me a free w-lan connection for my stay!The Staff was multilingual and very helpfull. The breakfast had everything I needed.The location could have been better, but next to the train station and easy to get my next connection.I would gladly stay again.
Reviews.Author: franceNewYork

Reviews.Content: Budget Hotel Booked through expedia for about $100 CAD/nite. Only stayed one nite. Very close to train station and was mostly booked for a stop over so didn't matter. Not the nicest area of town, and had a difficult time locating this hotel.Watermain broke and we had no water. Hotel did supply us with bottled (carbonated) water though. Very small beds, but this is Europe so not unusual. Had cable tv and ended up watching MtV--good for entertainment considering not much else in area. Cheap grocery stores nearby which was good.
Reviews.Author: lil_squirrel

Reviews.Content: Oh my God!!!! We got a taxi from the airport and when we got to our hotel we nearly died! it was right in the middle of the red light district!!! It was a sleezy place but i suppose a safe place as there were police everywhere! Not many lively bars around mind you we did stay midweek in February. Oreillys Irish bar was good craic and the food was really nice there.The Brazilian bar next door is also good craic but i suppose it depends what company your in. There is alot of american idiots (sorry soldiers) who are based in Frankfurt and will at any chance they get try to annoy you! Please steer well clear of them!!!! Took a trip on the tram to Sachenhausen, it was lovely , would have preferred to be there at a busier time though as the pubs were dead. Ate in a beautiful restaurant there and had Schnitzel(pork in breadcrumbs) would definatley recommend you try it! out of ten i would give the hotel 5/10 as the staff were very ignorant and lazy.
Reviews.Author: Blondiest

Reviews.Content: Not Impressed
Reviews.Author: moreholsplease

Reviews.Content: Good hotel, great location, inexpensive Stayed here for one night, and was pleasantly surprised. Though very inexpensive, this is a clean hotel with a great location. Popular with a younger and international crowd. Breakfast was included and good. Only small complaint was that the curtains were too thin to block out the light from the street lamp across. Would stay here again.
Reviews.Author: DonTobi

Reviews.Content: Museums only 5 minutes away I found the staff friendly and very international. Franfurts major museums were only a short walk across the bridge which is about 300 yards from the hotel.The rooms were clean, the breakfast more then sufficient, as much as you can eat.
Reviews.Author: JackTrost

Reviews.Content: 3 Words - Cheap, Location, Simple I have stayed in this hotel about 3 times in the last two years so I have good experience of the place!It is cheapIt is very very basic. no gym, pool, facilities, etcIt offers wifi access to web in the rooms for Euro12.50 a day. There is also a free PC in the lobby with free internet access although it is slow!Breakfast is included, basic but edible, to get you started for the day.Location is great, literally 1 min walk from red light district if thats ur thing, also very close to loads of restaurants, which offer a massively international cuisine! 1 min from some street markets where they sell cheeses and wines etc. 2 mins walk from the main railway station, so transport is great. id say it is about 10 min walk to the city centre which is great! This hotel is very basic, dont expect luxuries, but it is reasonably clean and location is its main selling point!If it wasnt for the amazing location i wouldnt reccomend this place but it really gives it a great advantage for the tourist who has limited time and wants to see it all!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Avoid This Noisy Location First, this hotel is very close to the main train station. Unfortunately, it is also close to the Red Light District. Extremely noisy! Unsafe feeling at night. The hotel is 'unkept'....the carpets in the entry were filthy. The bed was hard. our room overlooked the street, 7th floor and extremely noisy. Unfriendly hotel staff. Avoid unless you are desperate.
Reviews.Author: Rotechgirl

Reviews.Content: Basic Hotel in Good Location This is a budget hotel in the heart of Frankfurt. The location is good but the hotel is very basic. Although we had a non-smoking room , the whole hotel had the odour of tobacco. We had ordered a room with a double bed but ended up with two single beds. Pushing the beds together was of little assistance. The bathroom was large and had obviously been renovated. We were not expecting breakfast to be included in the price but were pleasantly surprised that it was. A very nice buffet breakfast indeed! We arrived at night so caught a taxi from the airport but walked to the railway station (less than 10 minutes) and took the short train ride to the airport on our departure.
Reviews.Author: station

Reviews.Content: close to banhoff Location, location, location with good access to all trains and tram and subways...that is the only thing good. The bed was ok and breakfast was ok too. The rooms and bathroom were dirty; no AC; filthy carpet and dusty furnishings; ripped towels. Again, if your priority is easy access to all ground transportation, then you're fine; otherwise, don't stay here.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Close to Train Station Very clean. Hard pillows. Close to train station. However right next to the Red Light district.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: discreto       bagno
